summary: Small player home located in the Reach.
descriptionHtml:
[img=center]http://i1241.photobucket.com/albums/gg510/Krucify77/TwinFalls.jpg[/img]

[color=#728FCE][font=\"Segoe Script\"][size=18]Description[/font][/color][/size]

Twin Falls Cottage, is a player home located next to, well, two waterfalls. It features most of the things you will need and want. It has a beautiful mountainous view that you will just have to see for yourself. There\'s nothing you have to do to get the home.

[color=#FF0000][font=\"Segoe Script\"][b]If you like this mod, please endorse. As with all modders, it gives us incentive to keep going. =)[/b][/font][/color]

[color=#FF0000][font=\"Segoe Script\"]No God items[/font][/color]
If you can pick up an item it will not re-spawn. Most items are static and if there is something you do not like use the console, then click the item, and type disable.

[color=#FF0000][font=\"Segoe Script\"][b]To get access to the home, just make your way there and it\'s yours. Alternatively, you can use the coc command, coc twinfallsexterior.[/b][/font][/color]

[color=#728FCE][font=\"Segoe Script\"]Outside Features[/font][/color]

Map marker
Breathtaking layout & scenery
Outside lighting at night
Bridge across the river
Sitting area to take in the views
Full crafting area w/ storage
Much more

[color=#728FCE][font=\"Segoe Script\"]Inside Features[/font][/color]

1 Entrance
Decent amount of storage (Non Re-spawning, 100% Safe)
Realistic lighting (Lighting is based off of vanilla, so if you use a mod you may get different effects)
Cooking spit
Library shelf that holds a decent amount of books
Basement with alchemy and enchanting tables, 8 weapon racks, 2 shield racks, 4 weapon plaques, and 6 mannequins
All 10 shrines available
100% navmeshed inside and out.

[color=#728FCE][font=\"Segoe Script\"]Known Issues[/font][/color]

Bethesda\'s navmesh problems still exist. I recommend running on version 1.5.26. Nav-mesh currently works, sort of. However, if you go a few cells away and come back to the house the nav-mesh will stop working and actors will stand in place.  If you run on version 1.5.24 you will CTD while trying to enter the home.  Navmesh problems is Bethesda\'s issue, not mine.

If you see floating grass outside this is an issue with the creation kit and the game not updating properly, however there is a temporary fix for this.  To get the grass to update in your game properly, open up your Skyrim.ini and Skyrimprefs.ini and at the bottom of the grass section add these lines: 

bAllowLoadGrass=0
bAllowCreateGrass=1
bDrawShaderGrass=1

[color=#728FCE][font=\"Segoe Script\"]Conflicts[/font][/color]

Will conflict with any other mod that edits the same cells. 
No other conflicts that come to mind.

If you find any issues or conflicts, post the issue and i will sort it out.

[color=#728FCE][font=\"Segoe Script\"]Install/Un-install[/font][/color]

Use Nexus Mod Manger (Recommend).
To manually install unpack to your data directory, usually located in your steam directory.

[color=#728FCE][font=\"Segoe Script\"]Current Version =[/font][/color] [color=#00FF00][font=\"Segoe Script\"]1.2[/font][/color]

[color=#00FF00][font=\"Segoe Script\"]V1.2[/font][/color] - Added some decorations. Added a 2 mannequin version and a no mannequin version.
[color=#00FF00][font=\"Segoe Script\"]V1.1[/font][/color] - Tweaked the mannequins, hopefully they are nailed to the floor now.
[color=#00FF00][font=\"Segoe Script\"]V1.0[/font][/color] - Uploaded to Nexus.

[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=14078]Essen Lodge Player Home[/url] [color=#728FCE][font=\"Segoe Script\"]Check out my other player home, Essen Lodge.[/font][/color]

[color=#728FCE][font=\"Segoe Script\"]Thanks goes out to...[/font][/color]

Nexusmods, without them, there would be nothing to share. 
Bethesda, for a truly awesome game.

And most important, you guys, without you guys who would i share with? haha
author: Krucify
